product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.time_representativeness: 2017 calendar year production data, 2023 mix data
databases_and_lca_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2018)
Global Cement and Concrete (GCCA) EPD Tool Project Database version 3.1 (2021)
lca_information.allocation: Fly ash and silica fumes are waste products and burden-free. Ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows were excluded on the basis of cut-off criteria.

scenarios: Disposal of concrete at a landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration

carbon_emission_context.lifetime_absorption_of_co2: Carbonation is a natural process whereby concrete absorbs CO2 from the atmosphere.

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default.

references: Australasian EPD Programme. (2017). Guidance on the use of INA in EPDs.
Australasian EPD Programme. (2018). Guidance on the use of background LCI data.
EPD International. (2019). General Programme Instructions (GPI) for the International EPD System V3.01.
